operations.fsa.ver1
Class Composition

java.lang.Object
  operations.fsa.ver1.Composition

public class Composition
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains methods for composing new automata from existing automata.

Author:
Kristian Edlund, Axel Gottlieb Michelsen, Lenko Grigorov

Parameters:
a - an automaton
b - an automaton

observer

public static void observer(FSAModel a,
                            Automaton observer)
Computes an observer for the non-deterministic automaton P(a), i.e., the automaton where all unobservable events have been replaced with the empty event, epsilon.

Parameters:
a - a non-deterministic automaton
observer - the output, a deterministic observer of the automaton a.

isIn

private static long isIn(java.util.LinkedList<FSAState> sll)
Private function to check if a stateset is in the observer

Parameters:
sll - the stateset to check
Returns:
null if it is not in, else returns the id of the observer state

Private function for making a new state from a stateset

Sorting algorithm for sorting a list of states after id. Right now it uses bublesort

Parameters:
sll - the list of states to sort

getId

private static FSAEvent getId(FSAEvent e,
                              FSAModel a)
Gets the id for an event in another automaton. It is used for finding an event id based on the event name.

Parameters:
e - the event to search for
a - the automaton to search in
Returns:
returns -1 if it couldn't find the event, else returns the id of the event in automaton a
